verses.verse: To the chief <WH5329> Musician <WH5329> upon Shoshannimeduth, <WH7802> A Psalm <WH4210> of Asaph. <WH623> Give ear, <WH238> O Shepherd <WH7462> of Israel, <WH3478> you that lead <WH5090> Joseph <WH3130> like a flock; <WH6629> you that dwell <WH3427> between the cherubim, <WH3742> shine <WH3313> forth.
Before <WH6440> Ephraim <WH669> and Benjamin <WH1144> and Manasseh <WH4519> stir <WH5782> up your strength, <WH1369> and come <WH3212> and save <WH3444> us.
Turn <WH7725> us again, <WH7725> O God, <WH430> and cause your face <WH6440> to shine; <WH215> and we shall be saved. <WH3467>
O LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of hosts, <WH6635> how <WH5704> long <WH5704> will you be angry <WH6225> against the prayer <WH8605> of your people? <WH5971>
You feed <WH398> them with the bread <WH3899> of tears; <WH1832> and give them tears <WH1832> to drink <WH8248> in great <WH7991> measure. <WH7991>
You make <WH7760> us a strife <WH4066> to our neighbors: <WH7934> and our enemies <WH341> laugh <WH3932> among themselves.
Turn <WH7725> us again, <WH7725> O God <WH430> of hosts, <WH6635> and cause your face <WH6440> to shine; <WH215> and we shall be saved. <WH3467>
You have brought <WH5265> a vine <WH1612> out of Egypt: <WH4714> you have cast <WH1644> out the heathen, <WH1471> and planted <WH5193> it.
You prepared <WH6437> room before <WH6440> it, and did cause it to take deep <WH8328> root, <WH8327> and it filled <WH4390> the land. <WH776>
The hills <WH2022> were covered <WH3680> with the shadow <WH6738> of it, and the boughs <WH6057> thereof were like the goodly <WH410> cedars. <WH730>
She sent <WH7971> out her boughs <WH7105> to the sea, <WH3220> and her branches <WH3127> to the river. <WH5104>
Why <WH4100> have you then broken <WH6555> down her hedges, <WH1447> so that all <WH3605> they which pass <WH5674> by the way <WH1870> do pluck <WH717> her?
The boar <WH2386> out of the wood <WH3293> does waste <WH3765> it, and the wild <WH2123> beast <WH2123> of the field <WH7704> does devour <WH7462> it.
Return, <WH7725> we beseech <WH4994> you, O God <WH430> of hosts: <WH6635> look <WH5027> down from heaven, <WH8064> and behold, <WH7200> and visit <WH6485> this <WH2063> vine; <WH1612>
And the vineyard <WH3657> which <WH834> your right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> has planted, <WH5193> and the branch <WH1121> that you made strong <WH553> for yourself.
It is burned <WH8313> with fire, <WH784> it is cut <WH3683> down: they perish <WH6> at the rebuke <WH1606> of your countenance. <WH6440>
Let your hand <WH3027> be on the man <WH376> of your right <WH3225> hand, <WH3225> on the son <WH1121> of man <WH120> whom you made strong <WH553> for yourself.
So will not we go <WH5472> back <WH5472> from you: quicken <WH2421> us, and we will call <WH7121> on your name. <WH8034>
Turn <WH7725> us again, <WH7725> O LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of hosts, <WH6635> cause your face <WH6440> to shine; <WH215> and we shall be saved. <WH3467>
